page.title: 04TRANSPORT AROUND DUNS
page.content:
WE DID A TRAFFIC SURVEY OUTSIDE OUR SCHOOL WE FOUND OUT HOW MANY CARS, LORRIES ECT. PASSED. WE COUNTED AT DIFFERENT TIMES AND 2.15_2.30 WAS THE BUSIEST. WE DISCOVERED THAT CARS WERE THE MOST POPULAR,THEN LORRIES. A RAILWAY USED TO GO THROUGH THE DUNS AREA BUT ALL THAT REMAINS IS A MARK WHERE THE TRACK WAS AND THE STATION WHICH IS NOW A PART OF THE INDUSTRIAL ESTATE THERE ARE FEW BUS SERVICES EXCEPT FOR SCHOOL BUSES,PARTLY BECAUSE MOST FAMILIES HAVE THEIR OWN TRANSPORT AND BUS SERVICES RUN AT A LOSS.
150 OF OUR SCHOOL ROLL OF 207 COME TO SCHOOL BY BUS AND AT THE BERWICKSHIRE HIGH SCHOOL 600 OF THEIR ROLL OF 761 DO.
